chunks.en: Brothers, are there any suitable side hustles for beginners?
My job is relatively free, are there any side hustles with low investment that are suitable for beginners? Recommendations please...

Things like setting up a stall after work, delivering food, driving for Didi, or running errands are a waste of your life. These cannot be called side hustles, this is using your time to exchange for work compensation, and at the same time you lose your rest time outside of your main job.
If you're not careful, you might not get enough rest because of doing these things, which will affect your main job.
Some people may criticize me, but let them criticize, everyone's understanding is different.
Trade crypto, if you earn, you'll have financial freedom, if it goes to zero, you can work with peace of mind.
The most profitable side hustle is teaching others how to do side hustles.

The most reliable thing is to think carefully about how to combine your profession and interests. For example, if your interests are cycling, fishing, or playing chess, and your profession is writing code, then think carefully about how to use code to integrate cycling, fishing, or playing chess. If successful, you can make money, and if you fail, you will also gain something. This is your home field.
Doing those common side hustles will only passively get you caught in the rat race.
Female account on Little Red Book flaunting wealth
Low cost, low threshold, high return, is the impossible triangle of side hustles.
After all, if all can be satisfied, someone will definitely treat it as a main job and the income will decrease.
So, the poster should think about which one they can give up, or which one they can solve by using their own profession and resources, then there will be something to talk about.
Integrate public resources, become a big V, and sell courses
@pwelyn Yes, rest well after get off work, exercise your body, everyone's energy is limited
